quotes: Nothing in life that’s worth anything is easy.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: We need to internalize this idea of excellence. Not many folks spend a lot of time trying to be excellent.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: You can’t let your failures define you. You have to let your failures teach you. You have to let them show you what to do differently the next time.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: It’s important to make sure that we’re talking with each other in a way that heals, not in a way that wounds.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: Where you are right now doesn’t have to determine where you’ll end up.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: Issues are never simple. One thing I’m proud of is that very rarely will you hear me simplify the issues.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: Keep exploring. Keep dreaming. Keep asking why. Don’t settle for what you already know. Never stop believing in the power of your ideas, your imagination, your hard work to change the world.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: What we have already achieved gives us hope for what we can and must achieve tomorrow.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: While we breathe, we will hope.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: Change doesn’t come from Washington; change comes to Washington.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: One voice can change a room, and if one voice can change a room, then it can change a city, and if it can change a city, it can change a state, and if it change a state, it can change a nation, and if it can change a nation, it can change the world. Your voice can change the world.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: The best anti-poverty program is a world-class education.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: The future rewards those who press on. I don’t have time to feel sorry for myself. I don’t have time to complain. I’m going to press on.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: If you’re walking down the right path and you’re willing to keep walking, eventually you’ll make progress.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: Progress will come in fits and starts. It’s not always a straight line. It’s not always smooth path.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: We may come from different places and have different stories, but we share common hopes, and one very American dream.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: Why can’t I just eat my waffle?
author: Barack Obama

quotes: Let me tell you something. I’m from Chicago. I don’t break.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: There a few things in life harder to find and more important to keep than love. Well, love and a birth certificate.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: You know, you can put lipstick on a pig, but it’s still a pig.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: I think when you spread the wealth around it’s good for everybody.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: The worst thing that colonialism did was to cloud our view of our past.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: The role of citizen in a democracy does not end with your vote.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: My heart is filled with love for this country.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: We will outstretch the hand if you unclench your fist.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: Some things are beyond my control. For example, this whole controversy about Jay-Z going to Cuba – it’s unbelievable! I’ve got 99 problems, now Jay-Z is one.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: The bear is loose.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: I try to focus not on the fumbles, but on the next plan.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: Disagreement cannot mean dysfunction. It can’t degenerate into hatred.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: Am I exasperated? Absolutely I’m exasperated.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: I am president, I am not king. I can’t do these things just by myself.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: You know, look, our political life is like our individual lives. There are ups and downs. There are peaks and valleys.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: People don’t progress in a straight line. Countries don’t progress in a straight line.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: Let’s acknowledge that democracy has always been messy. Let’s not be overly nostalgic.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: The one thing I’m clear about is that I’d rather be a really good one-term president than a mediocre two-term president. And I—and I believe that.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: You know, we live in history. And it’s complicated. And things aren’t always, you know, completely clean.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: I don’t think anything prepares you for the presidency.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: I was never the likeliest candidate for this office.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: I actually believe my own rhetoric.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: I think that I have the capacity to get people to recognize themselves in each other.
author: Barack Obama

quotes: Yes We Can!
author: Barack Obama
